At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

WCIB Data Engineer & Data Analyst

Wealth, Corporate, Commercial and Institutional Banking (WCIB) at US Bank manages approximately $9B in revenue, $3.1B in net income and generates approximately 37% of overall revenue for the bank. Corporate and Commercial Banking offers lending, equipment finance and smallticket leasing, depository services, treasury management, capital markets services, international trade services and other financial services to middle market, large corporate, commercial real estate, financial institution, non-profit and public sector clients. Wealth Management and Investment Services provides private banking, financial advisory services, investment management, retail brokerage services, insurance, trust, custody and fund servicing through four businesses: Wealth Management, Global Corporate Trust & Custody, U.S. Bancorp Asset Management and Fund Services.

WCIB’s relationship-oriented teams are immersed every day in the management of their relationships with the wealth, commercial and institutional client segments. Each of these teams has a deep understanding of their clients’ needs and regularly partner with enterprise analytics to help bring the full spectrum of WCIB offerings to meet these needs.

We are looking for top notch analyst to provide analytics support to our WCIB business stakeholders with hungry, curious and do-whatever-it-takes attitude. Our analyst is an expert professional who works independently. This position is responsible for drawing solutions from multiple domains and weaponizing data.

You, your team and its culture:

You will work with an amazingly agile multi-cultural team that is helping to build tomorrow’s bank. The team is rapidly growing both in terms of its influence and impact. You will experiment, build strong relationships, learn complexities of banking, observe data along with human behavior/incentives, drive digital adoption, lead new ways of doing business and get to be a true champion of impactful, industry-leading data-driven analytic solutions. Team encourages open culture, free exchange of thoughts and fosters a startup mentality.

Your day to day:

Responsibilities include working on big data/analytics projects, including gathering and integrating large volumes of data, performing analysis, interpreting results and developing actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. This includes hands on data development, designing, developing and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure to ensure the availability, accuracy and performance of our data dashboards. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources and systems including data mining, data auditing, aggregation, validation and reconciliation. This position may also have a working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, SAS, SPSS, Geo-spatial tools and others to perform analysis, interpret data and build advanced analytic solutions.

You will also work on advancing the development of metrics, reports and analysis into integrated dashboards that support field-based relationship managers and product leaders in Wealth, Corporate, Commercial and Institutional Banking (WCIB). Through the deep understanding of your users and the data you will consult on statistical analysis performed by your Data Science peers as well as contribute to measuring the key business outcomes as new analytic products are tested with the relationship manager and leadership team in WCIB. You get to work with leading ML and AI tools – both on-prem and cloud. This role will also play an active role with other data engineers, Salesforce experts, and business line product owners in the business line ensuring the critical data is available and reliable in the proper platforms with clear SLAs.

Key Deliverables:

Communication/Presentation

Communicate complex data concepts, metrics and dashboards to a non-technical audience.
Engage with business stakeholders, challenge assumptions and build industry leading analytical solutions.
Partnering with new and existing data vendors.

Domain Expertise

Quickly learn complex B2B banking dynamics and design data-driven solutions that create competitive differentiation.
Familiarity and understanding of banking and investment products and services.

Data Engineering

Wrangle, join and create new data from a variety of different sources and efficiently create a unified user-friendly dashboard for the business.
Enable a data foundation that includes advanced analytic solutions for RM’s that allows them to find, track and discover opportunities.
Research data assets from multiple disparate sources, applies various technologies find and move data assets for analysis, development of metrics, reports, and statistics.
Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles
Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review
Identify and lead the remediation of key data quality issues impacting Salesforce and our ability to deliver
Participate in the buildout of the analytics delivery, reporting and technology infrastructure required to support the delivery of insights and reporting.

Analytics / Data Science

Exploring statistical analysis that could be applied to the data; Performing descriptive statistics, exploring datasets, building visualizations iteratively to explore and understand the data
Conduct exploratory analysis and partner with data science team to design ML/AI solutions

Dashboard Development

Building business friendly dashboards in Microsoft Power BI or similar dashboarding tool such as Tableau.
Delivery of advanced analytic solutions via modern BI tools that prioritizes potential new leads to improve prospecting, data for deepening engagement within our existing client set, and reducing the risk of attrition.

Innovation

Curiosity and proactiveness to research new and cutting-edge data sourcing and development technologies such as web scraping, text analytics and NLP.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent work experience
Five to Seven years of statistical and/or data analytics experience

Women’s and Children’s Crisis Shelter

Job title: Data Analyst

Department: Administration

Reports to: Director of Operations

For over 46 years, the Women’s & Children’s Crisis Shelter has provided programs and services that form a critical continuum of response, healing, and prevention to survivors of domestic violence and their families. To encourage survivor self-determination, services are delivered through an intersectional, strengths-based, and trauma-informed lens that aligns with our mission of commitment to provide safety shelter and hope to victims of domestic violence.

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. Data analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities for services and financial expenses. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

· Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.

· Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

· Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.

· Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.

· Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.

· Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.

· Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Represents the agency at assigned community meetings; and assures, maintains, and demonstrates professional behavior leadership.

· Must have great understanding of confidentiality and ethical conduct, have good writing skills, and be a self-starter as well as a team player.

· Develop ongoing referral relationships with health, legal and social service system.

· Maintains a written record of operations in a timely manner through client log, client files and client service activity sheets.

· Work directly with agency’s accounting vendor for finance reports and end-of-month data.

· Enter financial data into QuickBooks for monthly reporting.

· Performs additional duties as requested by supervisor.

Required Qualifications:

BA/BS from accredited college and equivalent experience.
State of California forty-hour Domestic Violence Training Certificate preferred.

· Bilingual English/Spanish preferred.

· Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques

· Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).

· Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)

· Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

· Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.

· BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics Must exhibit flexibility, mature judgment, confidence, and competence.

· Good writing and communication skills.

· Must have current California Driver’s License, good driving record and current automobile insurance.

Job Title: Technical Sales Specialist - Data Analytics and AI
Job Description:
Technology Solutions and Pre-Sales; Healthcare, AI & Analytics


We are seeking a consultative problem-solver to drive our Service Line Sales within our Healthcare Solutions practice. This role will primarily focus on identifying and driving opportunities and solutions in Data, Analytics and AI within the practice.


We are looking for a key leader with deep expertise in data management, analytics and AI in the healthcare and life sciences sectors and experienced in driving revenue growth in this space.


You should have some consulting experience, market leadership, relationship management, sales quota attainment, and excellence in achieving both annual revenue and profitability targets.


You will manage a portfolio of accounts for revenue growth, new business identification and conversion, establish and lead relationship with client stakeholders, and run financial and demand forecasts for your portfolio. You will be in a true P&L role – responsible for revenue and total contract value growth in data and analytics.


About Cognizant’s Healthcare Business:



In healthcare, meeting next-generation consumer expectations means delivering whole-person care and creating unified experiences, across physical, digital and stakeholder silos. To achieve success, Cognizant helps organizations modernize foundational IT infrastructure and move to an ecosystem-based operating model that prioritizes collaboration, agility and resilience while delivering the care experiences that consumers demand - anytime, anywhere.

You will be responsible for the following:


Creating growth strategy and plan for pipeline generation for Data, Intelligence and AI offerings
Key client and cognizant stakeholder management for the domain across multiple accounts in the healthcare space.
Management of the account plan under the guidance of the client partner, investing time in strengthening existing client relationships and building relationships with strategic new clients and stakeholders
Work with Delivery Teams to validate cost and scope of solutions, understand opportunities for expansion.
Leading proactive proposals and RFPs
Partnering with internal leaders for solution storyboard, creation and execution.
P&L owner, responsible for sales, business development & Customer Relationship
Achieve annual revenue & total contract value targets.
Work in a matrix organization, responsible for prospecting and other sales management goals designed.
Collaboration with industry vertical teams, develop strong, long-term relationships with executives.
Manage the end-to-end sales process.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent; master’s degree preferred
Solid experience in a business growth / sales role in data modernization, analytics, AI and Machine Learning in the healthcare space
Experience with data migration, data management, governance analytics, reporting or similar.
Excellent ability and aptitude to influence and communicate effectively with business stakeholders up to the C-Suite.
Experience with large scale consulting and program execution engagements in the data, analytics, and AI space.
Experience navigating large organizations / internal stakeholders must be demonstrated.
Has understanding of GCP, Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks and how healthcare customers are using the technologies.
Has understanding of Vendor Intelligence and AI tools such as PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau, Sagemaker, OpenAI etc.
Able to articulate 360-degree aspects of the data and insights life cycle across the business value chain and identify /shape opportunities for customer improvement.
Strong technical skills with ability to find technical solutions to business problems and engage the potential customer with “consultative selling” is essential.
Excellent oral and written communication skills and executive presentation and persuasion skills are required.
Able to interface at all levels of an organization.
Knowledge of healthcare industry trends, customer pain points, potential opportunities in various areas like cloud, AI/ML, GenAI, modern data architecture, data governance, IoT and intelligent automation are highly desirable.
Entrepreneurial attitude / ability to work independently to drive business to Cognizant.


Why Choose Cognizant?

Position Summary:

Reporting to the UCHDW Director and UCHDW Chief Information Security Officer, the Senior Security Analyst is a strategic role critical to the delivery of secure, quality technical solutions for the UC Health Data Warehouse (UCHDW). This position is expected to support cyber security operations including defending against security incident, analyzing security events/alerts, communication, and supporting incidents response for the UCHDW. Primary responsibility involves monitoring, detecting, protecting and maintaining the security of data, systems and networks. Plans, configures, designs, develops, implements and maintains tools, systems and procedures to insure the integrity, reliability and security of data, systems and networks.

Total Compensation

In addition to the salary range listed below, we offer a wealth of benefits to make working at UCI even more rewarding. These benefits may include medical insurance, sick and vacation time, retirement savings plans, and access to a number of discounts and perks. Please utilize the links listed here to learn more about our:

Compensation practices (https://www.hr.uci.edu/partnership/totalrewards/compensation.php) and

Benefits (https://careersucirvine.ttcportals.com/pages/benefits).

Annual Rate Minimum $123,500.00 Midpoint $182,700.00 Maximum $241,900.00

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field and/or combination of education and equivalent work experience
Must demonstrate customer service skills appropriate to the job
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to rapidly acquire new knowledge and skills; strong analytical ability and data-driven mindset
Strong experience with information security principles, cloud security, scripting, networking principles, and incident response is required.
Expert technical understanding of a broad range of cyber security concepts and countermeasures including endpoint security, perimeter security, virtual networks, VPNs, cloud encryption, account management, application security, cryptography, and network security
Strong experience with AWS cloud computing and native cloud security tools
Strong knowledge of cloud management platforms
Strong understanding of Cloud Access Security Brokers (CASB), Cloud Workload Protection Platform (CWPP), Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM), and cloud web application firewalls
Strong knowledge of identity access management and supporting security technologies (role-based access control, MFA, Management Groups, Policy, Okta) and applicable working knowledge of cloud security frameworks, standards, and best practices
Experience with cloud deployment, technical and security architecture, database architecture, virtualization, technical solution architecture, Amazon AWS, and systems infrastructure
Ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, orally and in writing, in an easily understood, authoritative and actionable manner
Ability to build collaborative working relationships with various internal and external stakeholders
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Ability to work well under pressure while maintaining professionalism
Ability to perform independent analysis of complex problems and distill relevant findings and root causes
Expert interpersonal skills sufficient to work effectively with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization
Effective organization skills
5-7 Years experience in cyber security with 2-3 years in a Health Care environment

Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of University and Medical Center organizations, policies, procedures and forms
Familiarity with container technologies like Docker, rkt, Swarm, Mesos, or Kubernetes
Knowledge of project management practices and project lifecycle processes
Industry recognized security certification (e.g., CISSP, GIAC series, CISA)
AWS Certified Security – Specialty certification

Job Title: Financial Analyst, Senior - USC Care MSO Finance
Job Description:
The Senior Financial Analyst assists in all decision support functions as well as the annual operating and capital budget processes utilizing a high level of problem solving skills and customer service responsiveness. The Senior Financial Analyst assists in maintaining and enhancing the functionality of budgeting, cost accounting and decision support systems, including system implementation and development of cost accounting standards. The Senior Financial Analyst performs work at an advanced level - reviewing and analyzing financial information for complex, difficult and varied management needs. He/She compiles and analyzes data obtained from numerous information systems and employs the judgment necessary to determine the accuracy and applicability of the conclusions. The position exercises independence and judgment in the management of their time and workload.

Performs complex financial reporting and analyses to assist the organization in business and financial short-and long-term planning. Assignments are either highly specialized requiring advanced knowledge of a particular financial area, or analyses may be more general requiring a thorough knowledge of a broader range of financial activities. Performs duties relating to data collection, analysis, and reporting of various clinical, quality and financial information including CFTE calculation and productivity benchmarking. Primary responsibilities include: collaborating with management regarding financial; clinical analysis; designing and generating standardized and financial patient level reports and analyzing related data; performing trend analysis on data, developing and maintaining portions of clinic information structure in multiple systems. Expected to provide input and guidance to other team members, proactively identify opportunities and work on projects with moderate to high complexity, risk and scope. In this role, the analyst will be asked to lead projects, identify opportunities and develop recommendations for improvements.

Essential Duties:

Coordinates, organizes and completes strategic and complex projects of a financial or business nature requiring identification and extraction of data, evaluation, interpretation, analysis and summation of findings.
Presents results formally to senior management.
Pull data from a variety of source systems, use critical thinking skills to analyze the data,
Develop and maintain portions of clinic information structure in multiple systems.
Provides input and guidance to other team members, proactively identify opportunities and work on projects with moderate to high complexity, risk and scope.
Produces regular and ad-hoc financial and operating reports.
Evaluates and analyzes reports and data.
Responsible for the preparation and analysis of the periodic management reporting of financial results for assigned functional areas.
Develops conclusions and recommendations and communicates orally or in writing to management.
Monitors financial operations for the ambulatory care/ clinics
Identifies problems or trends and evaluates for solutions. Research and prepare variance analysis and explanations .
Seeks resolution or brings to the attention of senior management for consideration.
Reviews existing accounting, reporting and data management systems and methods for adequacy. Perform Balance Sheet account reconciliations,
account analysis, accrual calculations, and other related accounting documents/schedules.
Contributes to the development and/or modification of financial systems and applications to enhance reporting and information capabilities.
Responsible for identifying and bringing forward suggestions, corrective actions, process improvements or solutions to improve organizational
performance.
Responsible for performing special projects to improve process efficiency and performance.
Performs other duties as assigned.


Required Qualifications:

Req Bachelor's degree 4 year degree in Accounting or Finance
Req 3 years Financial analysis and reporting with knowledge of computer simulation and forecasting techniques.
Req Able to perform a variety of financial activities including planning, analysis, budgeting, and reporting.
Req Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Req Able to present financial information and models in a concise and easily comprehensible manner.
Req Working knowledge of financial strategies.
Req Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.
Req Detail-oriented and able to perform in a high-pressure environment.
Req Proficiency in Microsoft Office and SAP, Oracle, or related financial systems.
Req Familiarity with financial concepts, in depth knowledge of medical terminology as well as ability to prioritize workload to meet deadlines.


Preferred Qualifications:

Pref Master's degree In related field.


Required Licenses/Certifications:

Req Fire Life Safety Training (LA City) If no card upon hire, one must be obtained within 30 days of hire and maintained by renewal before expiration date. (Required within LA City only)

Position Summary:
Odyssey Systems has an exciting new opportunity for a Budget Analyst to support the US Space Force, Space Systems Command, Military Communication (MilComm) Directorate with a broad range of financial management capabilities to execute effective and responsive integrated program management of space-related research, development, production, and lifecycle acquisition activities.

As a Budget/Financial Analyst you will assist the Government in budget integration, Planning, Programming, Budget, and Execution (PPBE) and commitment/obligation/expenditure reconciliation.

Additionally, the Directorate is responsible for effective administration, management, and execution of resources for all programs within its portfolio providing effective planning, programing, budgeting and execution. The goal of this effort is to support financial management requirements and justification activities.

***Contingent upon contract award.
Responsibilities:
Duties include, but not limited to:
Develop products or deliverables, train, brief, integrate, correlate and analyze various phases of the Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution (PPBE) process as they apply to the administration and management of all programs within the Directorate.
Assist the Government with management of the POM process and development, analysis and integration of POM products.
Ensure compliance with Financial Improvement and Audit Readiness guidelines
Assist the Government in performing research, conducting reviews and providing assessments in support of milestones such as
POM
Budget Exhibit preparation
Staffer Day preparations
Funds receipt
Spring Program Reviews
Program Management Reviews
Mid- year Execution Reviews
Baseline Execution Reviews
Vice-Commander’s Forum
Business Management Reviews
Provide internal process and procedure efficiency and improvement initiatives.
Analyze data from various Government accounting systems and Program Contractor inputs/reports to support training; data collection; documentation; reconciliation of current, prior and canceling year budgets; and budget execution for all Programs in the Directorate’s Portfolio.
Perform Commitment/Obligation/Expenditure Reconciliation on the following funding to include but not limited to U.S. Government, foreign military sales, other foreign Government, and International Partner Agreements.
Assist the Government with all recurring and non-recurring financial reviews to ensure unliquidated obligations are recorded; in the proper stage of accounting; valid and correct; dormant/not dormant; and ensure documentation exists to support the recording of the obligations and commitments.
Recommend remedial actions as necessary to resolve commitments, obligations, and expenditures discrepancies
Assist the government in Program Control, Integration and Action Team duties to develop, train, analyze, staff and report to internal and external offices
Qualifications:
Minimum Required Qualifications:
Citizenship: Must be a US citizen
Clearance: Must have and be able to maintain an active Secret clearance
Education: High school diploma
Years’ experience: 13 or more years directly applicable experience in DoD Financial Management OR,
Associate's Degree plus 11 or more years directly applicable experience in DoD Financial Management
Bachelor's degree plus 7 or more years directly applicable experience in DoD Financial Management

Additional Information:
Location: Located in El Segundo, CA at Los Angeles Air Force Base (LAAFB)
Travel: Travel may be required up to 10%
Onsite: This position is onsite, unless directed otherwise and/or coordinated with the government customer.

About the Department/Position:

Under the general direction of the Director of Enterprise Systems, the Senior Technical Business Analyst is responsible for providing technical support, upgrades, and enhancements to the CSU Dominguez Hill's PeopleSoft Campus Solution System including but not limited to Financial Aid and Student Financials Modules, and other Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems. Works closely with end-users and internal customers to ensure the integrity of the application and data stored in ERP systems. Serve as a liaison between I.T. and business units to coordinate improvements, upgrades, and system testing.

Overview of Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintains comprehensive knowledge of PeopleSoft Campus Solutions, with emphasis on Student Financials and Financial AID, and how these modules are implemented and used within the CSU and at CSUDH.
Responsible for creating and maintaining digital forms, including creating workflows, and ensuring compliance with CSU Accessible Technology Initiative (ATI).
Responsible and accountable for monitoring, and responding to, user-reported issues through the university ticketing system; performing root cause analysis leveraging technical tools and techniques (such as data analysis, business process analysis, performing traces, monitoring systems and logs, etc), writing issue resolution and post mortem documentation, testing fixes, coordinating with end users to confirm the proposed fix resolves the issue, and applying fixes to production.
Use Business Process Improvement (BPI) methodologies to analyze current system processes, and make recommendations on leveraging technology for improved business process efficiency.

Minimum Qualifications:

Graduation from a four-year college or university, preferably in computer science or business or equivalent training and applied experience.
At least eight (8) years of professional-related experience which include system analysis techniques.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Comprehensive knowledge of PeopleSoft Campus Solutions.
Comprehensive knowledge of standard theories, principles, practices and techniques applicable to a university/high education environment.
Comprehensive understanding of PeopleSoft equation engine as used by Financial Aid and/or Student Financials.
Demonstrated working knowledge and experience in performing PeopleSoft tracing and debugging, reading and analyzing trace files, PeopleCode, SQL, and SQR.
Comprehensive knowledge of and ability to perform methodical root cause analysis, and implement controlled change management techniques to successfully resolve bugs and end user-reported issues.
Demonstrated ability to stay well organized and tasked with priorities in a high-paced environment.
Skilled in critical thinking and decision-making.
Comprehensive understanding of technologies involved in ERP systems such as third-party tools, databases, operating systems, reporting tools, etc.
Strong familiarity with Systems application development life cycle; software testing.
Comprehensive knowledge of Financial Aid and Student Financials PeopleSoft Modules.
Must be able to effectively communicate in meetings and discussions with non-technical people to gather and synthesize requirements.
Must be able to effectively explain business processes to technical and non-technical people.
Possess strong reading comprehension skills to evaluate and interpret policies and procedures.
Comprehensive ability to learn new software releases and modules and analyze technical requirements.

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science or business, or equivalent training and applied experience.
Experience in the CSU or higher education.
Experience with programming and database languages
Experience with API and integration tools and languages
At least (10) years of experience using and/or supporting a student information system.
At least (5) years of experience supporting PeopleSoft Financial Aid and Student Financials modules.

JOB
The City of Anaheim Human Resources Department is seeking professionals who are dynamic, enjoy contributing to a positive, team environment, and possess strong communication skills to serve in the Human Resources Analyst I or II classifications. The ideal candidate should be highly motivated, analytical, a team player, collaborator, and results oriented to provide value-added services.This recruitment is being established to fill an immediate vacancy and to establish an eligibility list to fill current and future Human Resources Analyst I or II vacancies in the following divisions of Human Resources: Recruitment and SelectionOrganization and Development TrainingBenefits AdministrationDISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS: As a resource to City employees and the public, the Analyst must possess strong interpersonal skills, be customer service driven, and demonstrate knowledge of human resources hiring policies and programs.Human Resources Analyst I - This is the entry-level class in the Human Resources Analyst series. This class is distinguished from the Human Resources Analyst II by the performance of the more routine tasks and duties assigned. Though typically used as an entry-level class, incumbents must have prior human resources experience. Human Resources Analyst II - This is the full journey-level class within the Human Resources Analyst series. Employees within this class independently perform the more complex duties and may have responsibility over an assigned program or activity. Assignments are typically received in broad, outlined form, and incumbents are expected to act independently in developing applicable resources and information.The City of Anaheim reserves the option to hire at either Human Resources Analyst I or II level based on candidate qualification and selection process Salary RangeHuman Resources Analyst I$68,178.00 - $93,744.00 AnnuallyHuman Resources Analyst II$82,870.00 - $113,947.00 AnnuallyUpcoming Increases: 5% increase on June 21, 20245% increase on June 20, 2025

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
The following functions are typical for this classification. Incumbents may not perform all of the listed functions and/or may be required to perform additional or different functions from those set forth below to address business needs and changing business practices. Participate in implementing a variety of human resource programs and activities, including recruitment and selection, benefits administration, deferred compensation administration, and organizational development and training. Candidates are encouraged to provide their full range of experience in Human Resources, should this recruitment be referred for other related positions. Conduct research, analyze data, and prepare written and statistical reports for a variety of human resources administrative, operational and policy issues; analyze alternatives and make recommendations; discuss findings with management staff and prepare reports of study conclusions; oversee and assist in the implementation of recommendations. Provide guidance to operating departments on a variety of human resources issues; consult with managers and employees regarding the interpretation and application of practices, policies, and procedures including related laws and regulations. Update and revise policies, procedures, and regulations and various handbooks as appropriate. Facilitate training on a variety of human resources policies, programs, and topics; develop training content and present to inter/intradepartmental audiences. Provide difficult and complex staff assistance to management staff; participate on, and provide staff support to a variety of committees and boards. Prepare and present staff reports and other correspondence as appropriate and necessary. Prepare and administer requests for proposals for a variety of benefits, training, recruitment, and related consulting services; draft correspondence, reports, and related documentation; develop criteria to evaluate vendor proposals and participate in the vendor selection process; submit staff reports required for Council approval; administer approved contracts. Monitor State and Federal legislative changes on employment and benefits administration laws and regulations. Ensure policies and procedures are compliant with any changes in law. Conduct small group or one-on-one training interventions; meet with management to identify training and development needs and/or skill deficiencies within a work group; facilitate intervention meetings, team building, and problem-solving exercises. Conduct feedback sessions with managers, supervisors, and employees. Plan, design and develop recruitment and selection materials and examinations; develop recruitment outreach and promotional material; screen applications; score and analyze results of written, oral and performance examinations. Coordinate with department hiring managers and oversee the full-cycle recruitment activities using NeoGOV. Develop test administration and evaluation criteria, review and validate tests. Administer selection testing and interviewing activities; develop and administer assessment centers. Participate in employment outreach activities including representing the City at job fairs and other events. Develop innovative approaches to recruitment strategies. Collaborate with operating departments to respond to requests and inquiries regarding employment opportunities with the City. Respond to a variety of surveys including, including benefits and operational studies. Evaluate changes to bargaining unit memoranda of understanding for changes to benefits and human resources procedures. May participate in the development and monitoring of assigned budget; monitor expenditures and program revenues. Coordinate assigned activities with other departments, outside agencies and service providers. May supervise, monitor and review the work of technical and clerical staff involved in personnel functions. Respond to public inquiries in a courteous manner; provide information within area of assignment; resolve complaints in a professional and timely manner. Attend and participate in professional group meetings; maintain awareness of new trends and developments in public sector human resources; incorporate new developments as appropriate into programs. Provide professional staff assistance to the Human Resources Director and other management staff. Perform related duties as required.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
IMPORTANT APPLICATION INFORMATION AND INSTRUCTION Applications will be accepted on a continuous basis until a sufficient number of qualified applications have been received. The deadline for the first review of applications is on Monday, November 13, 2023 at 5:00PM. Applicants are encouraged to apply early. Applicants that apply after the first review are not guaranteed to be considered for this recruitment. This recruitment may close at any time without notice after the first review date. The selection process will consist of a minimum of skills examination and oral interview. The eligibility list established from this recruitment may be used to fill the current and/or future Human Resources Analyst I or II vacancies within the City of Anaheim Human Resources Department. Candidates must be specific and complete in describing their qualifications for this position. Failure to state all pertinent information may lead to elimination from consideration. Stating "See Resume" is not an acceptable substitute for a completed application. The successful candidate will be required to undergo a reference / background check (to include a conviction record) and pass a post-offer pre-employment medical examination (which will include a drug/alcohol screening). The City of Anaheim utilizes E-Verify and new employees must provide documentation to establish both identity and work authorization. Communication regarding your application and/or status will be sent to the email address listed on your application. ARE YOU LOOKING FOR A GREAT PLACE TO WORK where the lives of children and their families are improved every day by fantastic treatment programs, such as Behavior Therapy, Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy, etc., then join Smile Pediatric Therapy & Diagnostics!

Founded by a therapist, Smile Pediatric Therapy & Diagnostics has been providing therapy, assessments, and early intervention programs to infants, toddlers, and school-aged children—in clinic, home, and school settings—for over 10 years.

SMILE IS A FUN, PROGRESSIVE THERAPEUTIC PEDIATRIC CENTER OFFERING:

Initial and ongoing training/mentorship to all employees including Early Start Denver Model (ESDM) training
Stimulating environment, with direct mentorship from multidisciplinary leaders in behavior therapy, as well as occupational therapy, speech therapy, & child development.
Highly competitive negotiated pay
Excellent vacation, health, dental, vision, and vacation benefits
Ample opportunities to grow professionally
Great company culture

Smile Pediatric Therapy & Diagnostics (Smile) is a play-based, pediatric assessment and treatment center that positively makes a difference every day. We are looking for a dynamic individual to join our multidisciplinary team as a BCBA to supervise our Behavior Therapy programs.

The BCBA will work closely with our Behavioral Therapy Leadership team and will be responsible for applying the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) while embedding a play-based, naturalistic, and developmental/child-centered approach to ABA, with a deep understanding of DTT and NET and/or PRT models. Applicants must be willing to learn additional therapeutic and evidence-based skills via the Early Start Denver Model (ESDM) and enjoy working within a multidisciplinary team. Desirable candidates must have a strong work ethic, excellent interpersonal skills, ability to work within home, school, and community settings, and have strong written and verbal communication skills. Multilingual is a plus.

DUTIES:

Conduct Functional Behavioral Assessments (FBA)
Review and analyze data
Write reports
Provide parent education and training during the FBA
Collaborate with team members
Attend Family Team Meetings

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:(please DO NOT apply if you do not meet ALL qualifications as your application will not be considered)

BCBA Certification required
Master's or Doctoral degree, preferably in special education, applied behavior analysis, or psychology.
Completion of coursework in Applied Behavior Analysis at the university level.
Extensive implementation experience in behavior treatment planning using applied behavior analysis evidence-based treatments.
Excellent written communication.
Strong time management skills.
Two years of professional experience working with children with autism spectrum disorders (ASD) utilizing a variety of research-based treatment modalities.
If applicable, the employee is required to maintain state licensure and accreditation for the duration of employment with the company. Proof of such must be submitted to the Employer on or before the first date of hire.

SPECIAL DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:

● CPR & First Aid Certified

● Livescan & TB clearance

● Completed Mandated Reporter Training

● Completed Crisis Prevention Training

● Immunization for Pertussis and Measles

● Immunization for Influenza (annual requirement).

● Ability to travel locally across service delivery catchment areas; maintain driving record in compliance with Transportation Safety Standards; maintain current minimum liability auto insurance and vehicle registration.

● Ability to relate well to children, their families, fellow staff members, and maintain positive affect.

● Previous field and administrative experience, with strong commitment to excellence and high standards, clinical, organizational, leadership, problem-solving, and analytical skills; able to manage priorities and workflow.

At Smile, you will be well-supported! Join our dynamic, growing team where our main goal is to be a platform for your success!

Smile supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

To learn more about Smile, please visit us at smileandwonder.com.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong technical skills
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or other related field

Experience with implementing tools for analyzing and governing very large data sets
Knowledge of the Axiom regulatory reporting system

Primary lead for requirements, product configuration and user acceptance testing management

Facilitate requirements review and design sessions with business owners
Maintain Business Use Case and Process Flows with requirement changes

Deliver engaging, informative, well-organized technical and business presentations
Deliver daily and weekly progress metrics
Train users in using the system according to process best practices
Provide business as usual support

5-7+ years of implementing & supporting D365 F&O/ERP applications. Hands on configuration knowledge of finance accounting, fixed assets, accounts payable & finance reporting modules on D365 F&O is a must.
Advanced Excel skills, in particular around data validation, pivot tables and reporting financial data
Excellence in communication, collaboration, business presentations and meeting facilitation
Expert in business workflow modeling
Expert in project and product planning
Thorough understanding of GAAP accounting
Thorough understanding of SOX
Thorough understanding of source control, unit testing, and continuous integration practices

Experience with planning tools such as Oracle HFM, Workiva

Experience and skilled in SQL and other query languages.

The Senior Financial Analyst assists in all decision support functions as well as the annual operating and capital budget processes utilizing a high level of problem solving skills and customer service responsiveness. Position Purpose:

Asset Protection Analyst is responsible for identifying, distinguishing, and analyzing multiple components of a problem and providing conclusions using high-level quantitative skills.

The analyst responsibility is to analyze large data sets to isolate trends and business opportunities, conduct advanced modeling and build solutions and recommendations to drive performance improvement for Asset Protection Shrink performance.

Asset Protection Analysts typically take direction from AP Managers, work cross-functionally, and collaborate on assigned projects. Project management expertise, strong communication skills and cross-functionally partnering with all Asset Protection/AP teams and others throughout the division is critical for the success of an Asset Protection Analyst.

Key Responsibilities:

Conduct in-depth analysis using data collected & combined from multiple data sources to provide actionable recommendations for shrink improvement.
Create reports and dashboards that derive insights on AP KPI’s.
Build skills and knowledge including self-development, team knowledge and customer (internal) knowledge.
Act as a subject matter expert in advanced data analytics, statistical modeling, and quantitative analytical techniques.
Proactively contribute to the development and enhancement of data mining, monitoring and analytics to improve on existing or creation of new strategies for minimizing Loss/Shrink.
Responsible for developing and delivering effective, interactive presentations and reporting solutions for AP, operational & merchant leaders.
Create and distribute weekly and ad-hoc shrink reports.
Deliver reporting for weekly & monthly basis covering inventory performance
Support ad hoc data and analytics requests from leadership teams in Ops/AP/Merchandising departments.
Produce documents for teams and leadership to review and utilize. Deliver presentations to teams and executive leaders and sponsors. Synthesize findings and make recommendations to upper management.
Utilize the case management system to manage open incidents and create reporting for the department.
Analyze shoplifting and safety trends. Work with multiple department leaders to create solutions and Policies and Procedures to mitigate risk.
No associates report to this role, but requires the leadership of a work group: assign and review work and train to other team members (but not hiring, firing or disciplinary action)

Qualifications:

High School Diploma or equivalent.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to problem solve and research.
Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple projects.
Must be meticulous with strong organizational and analytical skills.
Must be an initiative-taker and able to work independently.
Must have strong time management skills and be able to complete all assigned tasks on schedule.
Proficiency in advanced elements of Microsoft Office - emphasis on Excel, Word, and Power Point

Preferred Education:

Bachelor’s Degree, MBA preferred and 2-3 years' experience in analytical role
Strong computer skills (Expert Excel & PowerPoint)
Experience leveraging business intelligence/query tools (SQL, MicroStrategy, Business Objects)
Strong analytics - ability to manipulate data and come to conclusions and make recommendations.
Experience in Internal Audit, Financial or Data Analyst, Forensic Accounting, Investigations, Corporate Loss; Knowledge of internal controls, accounting concepts, practices and procedures is required.
Experience with and commitment to Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI).
Proficiency in advanced elements of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook.

*Ability to efficiently work in a hybrid (remote and in-office) environment*

Job Title: Bill n Pay Business Analyst

Job Summary: We are seeking a Bill n Pay Business Analyst with IT experience to join our team at a 3PL (third-party logistics) company. The Bill n Pay Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing the billing and payment processes for the company, using data-driven insights to improve efficiency and accuracy. The ideal candidate will have experience in business analysis, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and IT, with a strong focus on process improvement and customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities:

Analyze and optimize the billing and payment processes for the company, using data-driven insights to improve efficiency and accuracy.

Develop and maintain the company's billing and payment policies, procedures, and processes.

Monitor accounts receivable and accounts payable balances and ensure timely collection and payment of outstanding invoices.

Manage payment terms and credit limits with suppliers and customers.

Process and manage electronic payments and receipts using relevant IT systems.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and develop billing and payment strategies that meet those needs.

Provide support to internal stakeholders on billing and payment issues, including resolving discrepancies and errors with suppliers and customers.

Develop and implement technology solutions to streamline billing and payment processes and improve efficiency.

Ensure compliance with company and industry regulations, including financial reporting requirements.

Provide regular reports on billing and payment performance, identifying areas for improvement and cost savings.

Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders and external customers to ensure customer satisfaction and timely resolution of issues.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in business administration, IT, Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

5+ years of experience in business analysis, accounts receivable, accounts payable, or related fields.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Experience in IT and knowledge of billing and payment technology solutions.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Knowledge of financial reporting requirements and regulations.

Preferred Qualifications:

Master's degree in business administration, IT, Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

Certification in business analysis, accounting, or finance (e.g., CBAP, CPA, CMA).

Experience in the logistics or transportation industry.

Experience with billing and payment systems (e.g., Bill.com, QuickBooks).

Knowledge of Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies.

Responsibilities

We are currently seeking a senior business analyst with deep level expertise in Identity and Access Management solutions, and the implementation of Identity Governance systems in the enterprise.
The Analyst will serve as a technical expert for requirements, design and implementation of Identity and Access Management systems and tools.
The analyst will also assess and evaluate integrations to provide resolution of complex system problems and meet evolving business and security needs.
This position will be responsible for understanding and supporting the design of client's organizational, procedural, and technological security controls within the context of the global regulatory frameworks and its suite of affiliated businesses.
An ideal candidate has a solid understanding of cybersecurity as it relates to Identity Governance systems, a proven track record of completing the business analysis work to successfully onboard applications into these systems, working in a team environment to bring projects in on time.
This role requires a broad mix of business and technical acumen coupled with polished communication and a strong desire to learn.
In addition to having strong technical skills, you must be comfortable in effectively communicating with business end users, technical IT teams, business partners, network providers, and business process outsourced vendors, all while being sensitive to a wide diversity of cultural and technical backgrounds in a global business environment.
Conducts interviews to gather requirements system integration into our Identity Governance system via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods then works with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements
Translates requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to project team then conducts peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements — verbally or through written documentation — to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for optimizing or further leveraging these processes
Develops and utilizes standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications
Collaborates with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision
Leads testing and documentation efforts for the team, mentoring junior analysts
Serves as a subject matter expert for Identity and Access Management in the IGA space
Participates in the QA of existing solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized including development of test plans as needed
Maintains Knowledge Base articles related to IGA processes
Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team
Creates ad-hoc and scheduled executive-level reports as required

TOP SKILLS:

Business Analysis for SaaS products – ideally in identity governance such as Saviynt or SailPoint
Identity (IAM/IGA/AD and Azure AD/SSO and federation)
Experience on requirements gathering/analysis by working with application teams to onboard their applications into an IGA (Identity governance) system
Development and execution of Testing plans
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modelling, verification, and methodology development in the Identity and Access Management space, including the Identity Governance area
10+ years of working experience in business analysis of Identity and Access Management, and/or information security capacity
Experience in information security concepts and applying them at scale
Understanding of internals of Identity Governance systems such as Saviynt/Sailpoint. Experience with SaaS offerings is a plus, Saviynt is preferred.
Experience in onboarding diverse applications into an IGA solution including provisioning, deprovisioning, granting of entitlements, and user access reviews is required
Experience with identity automation using ServiceNow workflows a strong plus
Experience creating and leading test programs for identity integration projects
Understanding of internals of IAM solutions such as Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Authenticator, MIM, Duo, Okta
Sound knowledge of all procedures, standards, and regulations for authorization and authentication, applied cryptography, and security vulnerabilities
Experience independently leading projects to completion
Experience with working with leadership and engineers
Able to exercise independent judgment, effectively prioritizing and executing tasks under deadline pressure
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail
Demonstrated excellent technical writing skills
Highly self-motivated and directed
Strong customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Ancon is on the hunt for a Business Analyst! We need individuals that are independent, trustworthy, and self-driven, who can work diligently to deliver the Ancon Mission! This role plays a key role in the overall growth and success of Ancon.

ANCON is an Industrial Service company with over 50 years of experience and credibility servicing the entire Industrial community. The Industrial Services Division has positioned itself throughout the Western United States and is a horizontally-integrated industrial cleaning provider. We specialize in Tank Cleaning, Turn Around Services, Municipal Services, Professional Services and Emergency Response Services. OUR MISSION is to deliver SUPERIOR SERVICE to our customers by rigorously working to improve our operational processes and tools, continuously grow our people’s talent and skills sets and ensure every project is carried out safely. OUR VISION; A family and friendly workplace with passionate employees who are united by shared values and guided by a desire to make ANCON the US Market Leader in Industrial Tank and Turn Around Services.




WHY WORK FOR ANCON?

This is a remote work opportunity
We offer competitive hourly wages based on skill and experience, with overtime opportunities and weekly pay!

Company paid life insurance

Vacation, Sick, and Holiday Pay
Group 401K with company match
A family-oriented and friendly work environment



WHAT’S THE JOB ALL ABOUT?

The Business Analyst will act as a partner across all management levels and liaison between IT and management. They will conduct data analysis at the Job or Entity level and offer actionable solutions to increase profitability. The Business Analyst will also strive to improve data integrity and processes. This will be achieved by compiling multiple datasets within Excel, creating re-usable Excel templates and/or using native reports.

Key Responsibilities:

Run Job Profit Tool and respective reports to identify the reason(s) of low performing jobs and suggest opportunities to increase profitability
Develop process documentation for various business units
Run large data sets in excel to identify trends of high performing and low performing jobs
Format data in Excel pivot tables and charts and PowerPoint
Read lengthy contracts and summarize key highlights to management
Present findings to stakeholders verbally and through written mediums
Update weekly management reports
Run ad hoc reports as required

REQUIREMENTS:

Must Haves:

Analytical and curious mindset
Comfortable with large data sets
Comfortable with Excel, Pivot tables, Pivot charts
Basic Data analysis skillset
Ability to Communicate trends and findings to management
Strong proficiency in word, PowerPoint, excel and Visio
Detail oriented work focus



Nice to Haves:

Experience in Contractor/Service oriented Job Costing
Experience in Contractor/Service oriented Billing
Comfortable in Salesforce and/of Field FX
Knowledge of industrial cleaning billing highly preferred

Epson is seeking a highly analytical and data-driven analyst to join our B2B Lead Management team. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing actionable insights and recommendations to support marketing initiatives and understand lead value and ROI to drive business growth. In this newly created role, the ideal candidate will have capacity for deep understanding of marketing data and the ability to apply statistical methods and data analysis tools to derive insights from complex datasets. They will also be responsible for communicating insights and learnings with both technical and non-technical audiences. This position will be based out of our Los Alamitos, CA office with the opportunity for a hybrid work schedule. At Epson, our hybrid schedule is only 6 days per month.




Principal Accountabilities
In addition to the following Epson's policies and procedures, principle accountabilities include, but are not limited to:




Insights & Analysis

Analyzes marketing data using DOMO, Salesforce, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, to provide customer insights to support data-driven business decisions
Regularly monitors progression of leads as they move from initial lead capture through the funnel and recommends changes to lead generation activity based on data and performance
Assists with transforming raw analytics data into actionable insight/opportunities for business stakeholders to help improve lead quality and inform lead generation strategies
Provides data-driven insights on the complete customer lifecycle, identifying points of friction and have a voice in recommended solutions



Reporting

Creates regular metrics and campaign performance updates and reports to management and business unit stakeholders that simplify complex data into easily understood stories
Develops, produces, and oversees the creation of regular, standard lead analytics reporting via Salesforce, PowerBI and DOMO
Leverages formal dashboarding and reporting tools to effectively share insights and data



Technical

Data blending, modeling and visualization in Power BI and DOMO
Assists with MarTech stack to ensure Adobe, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Pardot, LeanData, and other data partner integrations are in place to maintain data integrity
Assists in overseeing tagging and data structure initiatives to maximize consumer data collection and data sharing for the business


What You Will Bring

At least four years of professional experience (or equivalent) involving data mining, analysis, and reporting
Working knowledge of statistical concepts that impact the accuracy of data analysis (for example: significance testing, sampling methodologies, and using sample weights)
Familiarity with complex sales processes and distribution models
Exposure or experience working on or with Sales teams a plus
Proficient with SQL and familiarity with other programming languages a plus
Extreme attention to detail and a passion for using data to inform and influence
Strong written and oral communication skills and ability to effectively convey complex and data-related concepts to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences
High degree of flexibility and maturity, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively with others at varying levels of seniority within and outside the organization
Must be a self-starter, curious by nature, and willing to help define the marketing analytics discipline within Epson

The starting annual base pay for this role is between USD $85,890 and $118,098. Please note that this position’s salary range may include multiple levels. The actual base is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Job Title: Sr. Supply Chain IT Analyst - (Demand/Supply Planning)
Job Description:
At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water.

Consider applying here, if you want to:

Work in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact.
Develop lasting relationships with great people.
Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our Team Members.

Sr. Supply Chain IT Analyst - (Demand/Supply Planning)

The Sr IT Functional Analyst SCP serves as the IT liaison with Niagara business users, plans and coordinates the implementation and deployment of new software applications as well as enhancements, maintenance and upgrades of existing applications. The IT Functional Analyst is primarily responsible for providing timely application support to business users and ensures that application issues and problems are efficiently and effectively resolved. The IT Functional Analyst is responsible for the overall stability, configuration, and support of the supply chain planning technologies within Niagara. This position will collaborate with on-site IT teams and work to support supply chain planning department users at Niagara’s HQ. This is a hands-on role, requiring experience with Supply Chain Planning Applications such as Logility DP, SP, MP, IP, Supply Chain Guru, Demand Guru, etc…, and a thorough understanding of Niagara’s business processes and system capabilities to support functional areas such as material requirements planning (MRP), finished goods demand, supply and inventory planning, replenishment, deployment, production scheduling, as well as sales and operations planning. Responsibilities include gathering business and functional requirements, coordination with application vendors and/or internal development (technical) teams to ensure solutions are designed, built, and tested to satisfy/meet business, functional and non-functional requirements.

Responsibilities:

Design, build, and implement functional and technical solutions which meet desired business, functional and nonfunctional requirements
Support Supply Chain Planning users in the execution of their daily business process including production support (troubleshooting), user training and timely resolution of systems and production issues
Assume a lead role in developing business/application/functional/data integration solutions from source systems (Oracle EBS) to Logility via existing system interfaces and integration
Lead and actively participate in all phases of system implementation including requirements gathering, functional and technical design, system design and development, testing and roll-out and support.
Utilize disciplined software development methodology for continuous improvement and optimization of the Logility solution.
Provide Functional & Testing experience in the areas of Demand & Supply Planning of Finished Goods and Raw Materials, Production Scheduling, Sales and Operations Planning.
Assesses project impact of system changes on users and internal and external customers and stakeholders
Identify risks and benefits of alternate designs; calculates costs/benefits of potential actions or solutions to establish their viability/ROI
Leads team in test planning and execution tasks including Functional, Integration, Regression and User acceptance testing experience of Applications.
Responsible for issue, problem and change management functions to ensure application availability, uptime and service levels to business users
Ability to identify and address root cause of production problems, and a strong background in resolving application support issues
Ability to formulate and document requirements, design specifications, and test plans for extensions to Supply Chain Planning applications which include, reports, data integrations, conversions, and enhancements
Utilize disciplined software development methodology for custom software or COTS package implementation process for continuous evolution and optimization of the Logility applications and business solution.
Provide daily user support of the Logility functional modules such as demand planner, supply planner, manufacturing planner during and post systems implementation
Engage internal technical/development team, system administrators to resolve system bugs and issues
Troubleshoot transaction and other system issues
Fully document all configurations, customizations, and interfaces to other systems
Open and manage defect request tickets with vendors
Organize user training including documentation for all Supply Chain Planning related Logility system modules.
Follow industry standards related to software development lifecycle (SDLC) and software quality assurance (SQA) practices and methodologies to ensure quality of project deliverables and technical solutions.
Enforce and manage project deadlines and schedules
Commit to quality deliverables while ensuring technical solutions are on-scope, on-time and on-budget.
Accurately prepare written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective, professional, and engaging
Follow through with commitments and assume additional responsibilities without being asked
Provide weekly status reports.
Partner with internal, external and business partners to support the Niagara business application
Open and manage SR service request tickets with vendor level 3 support
Facilitate communication/relationship within Niagara business and IT

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business or information technology/computer sciences.
Min 8+ Years of experience/expertise with Logility or other supply chain planning solutions such as Demantra, Oracle SCP, JDA, SAP, ASCP, etc.
Relevant experience working in a consumer goods manufacturing industry
Experience with and exposure to Enterprise applications such as Oracle EBS, JDA, SAP etc. configuration and implementation methodology
Knowledge and understanding of supply chain planning concepts
Strong analytical, planning and organizational skills
Module design and configuration experience.
Advanced knowledge and understanding of MS-SQL database/table structures is desirable
Past experience as a functional analyst during one or more Supply Chain Planning software implementations is desirable
Experience in data management, reporting and business intelligence is preferred
Experience in integrating supply chain planning systems with ERP is preferred
Ability to work in a professional manner, be flexible, and handle interactions with all levels of the organization and with internal and external clients
Demonstrated ability to communicate well with other members of the team and with non-technical end users
Good written and verbal communications skills are required
Self-directed, organized, and motivated individual
24/7 on call support as necessary to resolve system critical issues
Self-starter with ability to work independently under pressure and react quickly to changing priorities
APICS CPIM/CSCP certification or certification in progress preferred
Prior experience with implementing and enhancing Supply Chain Planning systems in support of Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Manufacturing Planning, Master Planning, Inventory Planning functions
Proficient computer skills (i.e. Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint, Visio and Access)
Advanced SQL skills / Experience working with relational databases and tables
Proficiency in Supply Chain Logistics/Operations

Education:

Minimum Required: Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, Operations, Computer Science or Engineering
Preferred: Master’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, Operations, Computer Science or Engineering

Typical Compensation Range

Pay Rate Type: Salary

$95,301.00 - $138,186.00 / Yearly

Benefits

https://careers.niagarawater.com/us/en/benefits

Any employment agency, person or entity that submits a résumé into this career site or to a hiring manager does so with the understanding that the applicant's résumé will become the property of Niagara Bottling, LLC. Niagara Bottling, LLC will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

Employment agencies that have fee agreements with Niagara Bottling, LLC and have been engaged on a search shall submit résumé to the designated Niagara Bottling, LLC recruiter or, upon authorization, submit résumé into this career site to be eligible for placement fees.

Work Mode:
Onsite
Responsibilities:
Description:

Are you eager to help lead your discipline, serve as an expert of your craft and have a global impact? We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Senior Data Analyst to join our new AAA team, Uncapped Games. The ideal candidate will help drive analysis for an all-new and original IP - serving as a paradigm shift for the RTS genre. This position is for passionate experts of their craft, serving in a hands-on, cross-functionally minded role. If this sounds like you, we can’t wait to hear from you!
What you’ll get to do:
Plan and implement key metrics and game dashboards to monitor game performance, identify issues, and suggest improvements to drive user engagement, monetization, churn reduction, etc.
Help define target KPIs for pre-launch game testing with clear benchmarks, and analyze data collected from various user groups. Provide follow-up recommendations for enhancements
Develop MAU and DAU forecasts, as well as revenue forecasts as required. Fine-tune forecasts using small-scale testing data and post-launch metrics
Perform specialized data analysis on request, including segmentation of active and paying users, evaluation of new version performance and user perception, and unit tuning, among other tasks. Translating data into concise and actionable insights
Collaborate closely with designers to track and assess the impact of design decisions, monitor in-game economics and establish ROI targets for new in-game resources
Track marketing spendings and ROI, offering business insights and recommendations to optimize marketing efficiency. Conduct necessary analyses to support marketing decision-making
Requirements:
What we are looking for:
Experience in game development and live-ops games (competitive genres preferred)
User-centric, able to integrate user insights into data interpretation
Proficient in R / Python / SQL
Strong analytical and logical thinking skills, coupled with a collaborative, open-minded, and self-motivated mindset
Proven passionate approach to work cross functionally with multiple departments (i.e. design, publishing, data science) to drive towards consensus and optimal results for what is best for the game

Pluses:
A passion for RTS, strategy or MOBA games
Experience seeing multiple titles to completion, starting all the way from the pre-production phase to post launch data support.

Perks:
Freedom to dip your toes into other disciplines and influence others beyond the boundaries of your role.
Flexible full time remote work or hybrid in office model
Highly creative and collaborative start-up culture
Competitive pay and benefits.
